department.dept_long_name: Committee on the Study of Religion

course.title: Archaeology and the World of the New Testament: Seminar
course.description: The first portion of the course will introduce students to working with archaeological data from the Greco-Roman world (inscriptions, architecture, sculpture, coins). The second portion consists of seminars in Greece and Turkey during May, including some meetings with archaeologists and other scholars abroad
course.prerequisites: Greek and French or German; two half-courses in the study of ancient Christianity and/or Greco-Roman religion, history, and archaeology. Course may be divided with permission of instructor.
course.notes: Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 1870.
